images.caption: Figure 1:Evolution of entropy as training progresses on the validation set. Here HSTU is the backbone model.
Figure 2:User Priorleads to more personalized recommendations, especially on the minority user groups.
Figure 3:Scaling by context lengths and sizes for HSTU.

Figure 4:Visualization of the representation space for a particular user on Pixel8M. We plot item history, target items, and the top recommended items. The items recommended by different heads or interests are represented using different colors.
Figure 5:Comparison of composition strategies on Pixel8M across different HSTU model sizes.
Figure 6:Sensitivity to the number of segments in Temporal Prior across different HSTU sizes.
Figure 7:An instantiation of the hierarchical composition strategy with Temporal (LT/ST2) and Graph Priors.

Figure 8:A case study on Pixel8M. Top two rows: browsing history. Third row: ground truth target items. Fourth row: HLLM baseline predictions (filtered to “Informational & Educational”). Last row: predictions from our model’s long-term “Informational & Educational” head.
